etymology.description: Depicts a person standing between two lines or boundaries
etymology.interpretation: The character 介(介) (jiè, 'to derive an idea from') represents the concept of being in-between or acting as a mediator. It conceptually fits the idea of deriving by positioning oneself between different ideas or entities.

examples.chinese: 他从古代诗词中介出艺术灵感(他從古代詩詞中介出藝術靈感)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng gǔdài shīcí zhōng jiè chū yìshù línggǎn.
examples.english: He derives artistic inspiration from ancient poems.

examples.chinese: 科学家阅读文献时介出创新思想(科學家閱讀文獻時介出創新思想)，工程师从实验结果中介出改进方案(工程師從實驗結果中介出改進方案)。
examples.pinyin: Kēxuéjiā yuèdú wénxiàn shí jiè chū chuàngxīn sīxiǎng, gōngchéngshī cóng shíyàn jiéguǒ zhōng jiè chū gǎijìn fāng'àn.
examples.english: Scientists derive innovative ideas when reading literature, and engineers derive improvement plans from experimental results.

examples.chinese: 研究者从历史资料中介出重要信息(研究者從歷史資料中介出重要資訊)。
examples.pinyin: Yánjiū zhě cóng lìshǐ zīliào zhōng jiè chū zhòngyào xìnxī.
examples.english: Researchers derive key information from historical data.
